comments:
Running Eclipse 3.1 RC2

1.  Open CVS Repository Exploring Perspective.
2.  Open Debug Perspective.  In the debug perspective, open the Memory View.
3.  Switch to another view to cover the Memory View.
4.  Switch back to the Memory View.

Bringing the Memory View back to the top will cause this exception.  Not sure 
why bringing the Memory View to the top will cause a team action to update.

*** Bug 99387 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I've debugged this and the Memory view is providing a selection that consists 
of a single element that is null. If there is no selection, it should provide 
an empty selection.

Created an attachment (id=23082)
Patch to org.eclipse.debug.ui

Here's a patch that fixes the problem. The Memory view has a custom selection
provider for some reason and it was converting empty selections into selections
of a single element that was null.
RC3 candidate. Hard to resist a patch.
+1 from Darin W, CC'ing Darin S for additional vote.

Fixed in 
* AbstractMemoryViewPane
* MemoryView
* RenderingViewPane

- If the selection from the rendering view pane is empty, fire that empty 
selection.  Otherwise, create the selection.
- In RenderingViewPane, use a static empty selection.  This static selection 
represents an empty selection from the rendering view pane.
- In RenderingViewPane, if it receives an empty selection from a rendering view 
pane, simply ignore the selection change event.  The view pane can rely on a 
selection change from the memory blocks tree viewer to empty the view pane if 
necessary.
- This gauranteeds that the Memory View will not create a selection with an 
null element.
